thread.title: Roundup: Vermont, Hartford settle for draw
thread.title_full: Roundup: Vermont, Hartford settle for draw

title: Roundup: Vermont, Hartford settle for draw
text:
Roundup: Vermont, Hartford settle for draw Free Press Sports Staff 6:18 p.m. EDT October 11, 2015 Vermont back Sydney Cammeyer (22) closes down a Maine player in possession during Thursday's women's soccer game at Virtue Field. (Photo: AUSTIN DANFORTH/FREE PRESS) CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WEST HARTFORD, Conn. – Vermont took an early lead but could not hold off host Hartford as the two squads settled for a 1-1 tie in women’s soccer action on Sunday afternoon. 
Sydney Cammeyer gave the Catamounts (6-5-2, 3-1-1) a lead in the 22nd minute, scoring her first career goal on a shot from distance. 
The lead held until the final two minutes of regulation, when Tori Tripp finished off a give-and-go pass from Julia Carr to tie the game for Hartford (8-2-4, 2-0-3). 
Ally Ramos finished with seven saves for Vermont, while Jessica Jurg had four stops for Hartford. 
FIELD HOCKEY 
• Maine 3, Vermont 1: Maine used to two second half goals to pull away from Vermont in an America East conference matchup on Sunday at Moulton Winder Field. 
Syndey Veljacic, Cassidy Svetek and Libby Riedl each had a goal for the Black Bears (11-2). Emma Cochran earned the win in goal. 
Taylor Gaines tallied for the Catamounts (3-11), with Carla Godsman earning the assist, and Lena Benwood made four saves. 
• Mercy (N.Y.) 4, St. Michael’s 3 (OT): Alana Costantini struck for the game-winning goal 9 minutes, 51 seconds into overtime to lift host Mercy past St. Michael’s. 
Megan Deschaine, Abby Dusha and Jackie Matthews scored for the Purple Knights (4-7), while Abigail Bowie made four saves. 
Randi Zorn and Alicia Williams both had a goal and an assist for Mercy (6-5), and Kimberly Sands also scored. Julia Arnell made 16 stops. Read or Share this story: http://bfpne.ws/1LpL7iZ TOP VIDEOS
